column4: are their any plans for a centralized bookmark system in ubuntu?
is your irc client going "bing" a lot today? :)
i don't have a sound for it, but the channel button keeps turning blue :)
good question.  so they can nag the sysadmin i guess :P
you could try using dd in two passes, one for each part of the file, avoiding the EOF character
can you give me the command? i need this really quick
it picked a terrible time to get screwed up
sorry no, in essence i'm guessing, 'man dd' will be helpful

you could probably just 'cat badfile > anotherfile' for the first part, then something like 'dd if=badfile bs=1 skip=9999 >> anotherfile' for the 2nd part (where 9999 is the number of the byte _after_ the errant EOF byte)
byte of the file, or byte of the hard drive?
(sorry i stepped away) byte of the file.  It all swings on whether will interpret the EOF when it does the skipping.  Hopefully it won't
